bindings.author: Gerhard Riegler
bindings.description: Das Astro Binding berechnet astronomische Daten von Sonne und Mond.
bindings.name: Astro Binding

bindings.author: David Graeff
bindings.description: Unterstützt die Raspbee und Conbee Zigbee Dongles via Deconz
bindings.name: Dresden Elektronik Deconz

bindings.author: Deutsche Telekom AG
bindings.description: Dieses Binding integriert das Philips Hue System. Durch diese können die Hue Lampen und Leuchten gesteuert werden.
bindings.name: Hue Binding

bindings.author: David Graeff
bindings.description: Erlaubt die Verwaltung von MQTT Verbindungen und das Verknüpfen von MQTT Topics
bindings.name: MQTT Binding

versioninformation.message: You will encounter a mqtt:client not found if configured via textual files. Solution: Restart openHAB after each change.
The HomeAssistant discovery will not work correctly.

bindings.author: Marc Mettke, David Graeff
bindings.description: Das Network Binding überprüft, ob sich ein Gerät aktuell im Netzwerk befindet oder nicht.
bindings.name: Network Binding

channel-types.description: Das Alter des Mondes in Tagen
channel-types.label: Mondalter

channel-types.description: Höhe der Strahlung, nach Beugung durch Wolken und Atmosphäre
channel-types.label: Diffuse Strahlung

channel-types.description: Höhe der Strahlung nach Eindringen in die atmosphärische Schicht
channel-types.label: Direkte Strahlung

channel-types.description: Zeitpunkt wenn der Abstand erreicht ist
channel-types.label: Datum

parameters.description: Moves an event or datetime value forward or backward (in minutes)
parameters.label: Offset
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The earliest time of the day for the event or the datetime value (hh:mm)
parameters.label: Earliest
parameters.name: earliest

parameters.description: The latest time of the day for the event or the datetime value (hh:mm)
parameters.label: Latest
parameters.name: latest

channel-types.description: Gesamtmenge der Strahlung auf dem Boden
channel-types.label: Gesamtstrahlung

channel-types.description: The Button that was last pressed on the switch.
channel-types.label: Button

channel-types.description: This channel is triggered on a button event. The trigger payload consists of the button event number.
channel-types.label: Button Trigger

channel-types.description: Light level is below the darkness threshold.
channel-types.label: Dark

channel-types.description: Light level is above the daylight threshold.
channel-types.label: Daylight

channel-types.description: The date and time when the sensor was last updated.
channel-types.label: Last Updated

channel-types.description: Dawn is around 130, sunrise at 140, sunset at 190, and dusk at 210
channel-types.label: Daylight Value

channel-types.description: Ermöglicht die Steuerung der Helligkeit. Ermöglicht ebenfalls die Lampe ein- und auszuschalten.
channel-types.label: Helligkeit

channel-types.description: Ermöglicht die Steuerung der Farbe. Ermöglicht ebenfalls die Lampe zu dimmen oder ein- und auszuschalten.
channel-types.label: Farbe

channel-types.description: Ermöglicht die Steuerung der Farbtemperatur. Von Tageslichtweiß (0) bis Warmweiß (100).
channel-types.label: Farbtemperatur

channel-types.description: Der Licht Level ist unter dem Dunkel-Schwellwert.
channel-types.label: Dunkel

channel-types.description: Der Licht Level ist über dem Hell-Schwellwert.
channel-types.label: Hell

channel-types.description: Der zuletzt gedrückte Taster an dem Dimmer-Schalter.
channel-types.label: Dimmer-Schalter

channel-types.description: Triggers when a button is pressed on the dimmer switch.
channel-types.label: Dimmer Switch Event

channel-types.description: Zeit, zu der sich dieser Wert geändert hat.
channel-types.label: Letzte Aktualisierung

channel-types.description: Der zuletzt gedrückte Taster an dem Tap Schalter.
channel-types.label: Tap Schalter

channel-types.description: Triggers when a button is pressed on the tap switch.
channel-types.label: Tap Switch Event

parameters.description: An MQTT topic that this thing will subscribe to, to receive the state. This can be left empty, the channel will be state-less command-only channel.
parameters.label: MQTT state topic
parameters.name: stateTopic

parameters.description: An MQTT topic that this thing will send a command to. If not set, this will be a read-only switch.
parameters.label: MQTT command topic
parameters.name: commandTopic

parameters.description: Applies transformations to an incoming MQTT topic value. A transformation example for a received JSON would be "JSONPATH:$.device.status.temperature" for a json {device: {status: { temperature: 23.2 }}}. You can chain transformations by separating them with the intersection character ∩.
parameters.label: Incoming value transformations
parameters.name: transformationPattern

parameters.description: Applies a transformation before publishing a MQTT topic value. Transformations are specialised in extracting a value, but some transformations like the MAP one could be useful.
parameters.label: Outgoing value transformation
parameters.name: transformationPatternOut

parameters.description: Format a value before it is published to the MQTT broker. The default is to just pass the channel/item state. If you want to apply a prefix, say "MYCOLOR,", you would use "MYCOLOR,%s". If you want to adjust the precision of a number to for example 4 digits, you would use "%.4f".
parameters.label: Outgoing value format
parameters.name: formatBeforePublish

parameters.description: The value will be published to the command topic as retained message. A retained value stays on the broker and can even be seen by MQTT clients that are subscribing at a later point in time.
parameters.label: Retained
parameters.name: retained

parameters.description: If the received MQTT value should not only update the state of linked items, but command them, enable this option.
parameters.label: Is command
parameters.name: postCommand

parameters.description: A number (like 1, 10) or a string (like "enabled") that is recognised as on/open state. You can use this parameter for a second keyword, next to ON (OPEN respectively on a Contact).
parameters.label: On/Open value
parameters.name: on

parameters.description: A number (like 0, -10) or a string (like "disabled") that is recognised as off/closed state. You can use this parameter for a second keyword, next to OFF (CLOSED respectively on a Contact).
parameters.label: Off/Closed value
parameters.name: off

parameters.description: If you connect this channel to a Switch item and turn it on, color and saturation are preserved from the last state, but the brightness will be set to this configured initial brightness percentage.
parameters.label: Initial brightness
parameters.name: onBrightness

parameters.label: Incoming value transformations
parameters.name: transformationPattern

parameters.description: Applies a transformation before publishing a MQTT topic value. Transformations are specialised in extracting a value, but some transformations like the MAP one could be useful.
parameters.label: Outgoing value transformation
parameters.name: transformationPatternOut

parameters.description: Format a value before it is published to the MQTT broker. The default is to just pass the channel/item state. If you want to apply a prefix, say "MYCOLOR,", you would use "MYCOLOR,%s". If you want to adjust the precision of a number to for example 4 digits, you would use "%.4f".
parameters.label: Outgoing value format
parameters.name: formatBeforePublish

parameters.description: The value will be published to the command topic as retained message. A retained value stays on the broker and can even be seen by MQTT clients that are subscribing at a later point in time.
parameters.label: Retained
parameters.name: retained

parameters.description: If the received MQTT value should not only update the state of linked items, but command them, enable this option.
parameters.label: Is command
parameters.name: postCommand

parameters.description: If your MQTT topic is limited to a set of one or more specific commands or specific states, define those states here. Separate multiple states with commas. An example for a light bulb state set: ON,DIMMED,OFF
parameters.label: Allowed states
parameters.name: allowedStates

parameters.description: The value will be published to the command topic as retained message. A retained value stays on the broker and can even be seen by MQTT clients that are subscribing at a later point in time.
parameters.label: Retained
parameters.name: retained

parameters.description: This configuration represents the minimum of the allowed range. For a percentage channel that equals zero percent.
parameters.label: Absolute minimum
parameters.name: min

parameters.description: This configuration represents the maximum of the allowed range. For a percentage channel that equals one-hundred percent.
parameters.label: Absolute maximum
parameters.name: max

parameters.description: A number/dimmer channel can receive Increase/Decrease commands and computes the target number by adding or subtracting this delta value.
parameters.label: Delta value
parameters.name: step

parameters.description: A number (like 1, 10) or a string (like "enabled") that is additionally recognised as on/open state. You can use this parameter for a second keyword, next to ON (OPEN respectively on a Contact).
parameters.label: Custom On/Open value
parameters.name: on

parameters.label: Custom Off/Closed value
parameters.name: off

channel-types.description: An image to display. Send a binary bmp, jpg, png or any other supported format to this channel.
channel-types.label: Image

parameterGroups.name: transformations
parameterGroups.label: Transform values
parameterGroups.description: These configuration parameters allow you to alter a value before it is published to MQTT or before a received value is assigned to an item.

parameters.description: This channel will trigger on this MQTT topic. This topic can contain wildcards like + and # for example "all/in/#" or "sensors/+/config".
parameters.label: MQTT Topic
parameters.name: stateTopic

parameters.description: An optional condition on the value of the MQTT topic that must match before this channel is triggered.
parameters.label: Payload condition
parameters.name: payload

parameters.description: The trigger channel payload usually only contains the received MQTT topic value. If you define a separator character, for example '#', the topic and received value will be in the trigger channel payload. For example: my_topic#my_received_value.
parameters.label: Separator character
parameters.name: separator

channel-types.description: This channel is triggered when a value is published to the configured MQTT topic on this broker connection. The event payload will be the received MQTT topic value.
channel-types.label: Publish trigger

parameters.description: An MQTT topic that this thing will subscribe to, to receive the state. This can be left empty, the channel will be state-less command-only channel.
parameters.label: MQTT state topic
parameters.name: stateTopic

parameters.description: An MQTT topic that this thing will send a command to. If not set, this will be a read-only switch.
parameters.label: MQTT command topic
parameters.name: commandTopic

parameters.description: Applies transformations to an incoming MQTT topic value. A transformation example for a received JSON would be "JSONPATH:$.device.status.temperature" for a json {device: {status: { temperature: 23.2 }}}. You can chain transformations by separating them with the intersection character ∩.
parameters.label: Incoming value transformations
parameters.name: transformationPattern

parameters.description: Applies a transformation before publishing a MQTT topic value. Transformations are specialised in extracting a value, but some transformations like the MAP one could be useful.
parameters.label: Outgoing value transformation
parameters.name: transformationPatternOut

parameters.description: Format a value before it is published to the MQTT broker. The default is to just pass the channel/item state. If you want to apply a prefix, say "MYCOLOR,", you would use "MYCOLOR,%s". If you want to adjust the precision of a number to for example 4 digits, you would use "%.4f".
parameters.label: Outgoing value format
parameters.name: formatBeforePublish

parameters.description: The value will be published to the command topic as retained message. A retained value stays on the broker and can even be seen by MQTT clients that are subscribing at a later point in time.
parameters.label: Retained
parameters.name: retained

parameters.description: If the received MQTT value should not only update the state of linked items, but command them, enable this option.
parameters.label: Is command
parameters.name: postCommand

parameters.description: A string (like "OPEN") that is recognised as UP state. You can use this parameter for a second keyword, next to UP.
parameters.label: Up value
parameters.name: on

parameters.description: A string (like "CLOSE") that is recognised as DOWN state. You can use this parameter for a second keyword, next to DOWN.
parameters.label: Down value
parameters.name: off

parameters.description: A string (like "STOP") that is recognised as stop state. Will set the rollershutter state to undefined, because the current position is unknown at that point.
parameters.label: Stop value
parameters.name: stop

parameterGroups.name: transformations
parameterGroups.label: Transform values
parameterGroups.description: These configuration parameters allow you to alter a value before it is published to MQTT or before a received value is assigned to an item.

parameters.label: MQTT state topic
parameters.name: stateTopic

parameters.description: An MQTT topic that this thing will send a command to. If not set, this will be a read-only switch.
parameters.label: MQTT command topic
parameters.name: commandTopic

parameters.description: Applies transformations to an incoming MQTT topic value. A transformation example for a received JSON would be "JSONPATH:$.device.status.temperature" for a json {device: {status: { temperature: 23.2 }}}. You can chain transformations by separating them with the intersection character ∩.
parameters.label: Incoming value transformations
parameters.name: transformationPattern

parameters.description: Applies a transformation before publishing a MQTT topic value. Transformations are specialised in extracting a value, but some transformations like the MAP one could be useful.
parameters.label: Outgoing value transformation
parameters.name: transformationPatternOut

parameters.description: Format a value before it is published to the MQTT broker. The default is to just pass the channel/item state. If you want to apply a prefix, say "MYCOLOR,", you would use "MYCOLOR,%s". If you want to adjust the precision of a number to for example 4 digits, you would use "%.4f".
parameters.label: Outgoing value format
parameters.name: formatBeforePublish

parameters.description: The value will be published to the command topic as retained message. A retained value stays on the broker and can even be seen by MQTT clients that are subscribing at a later point in time.
parameters.label: Retained
parameters.name: retained

parameters.description: If the received MQTT value should not only update the state of linked items, but command them, enable this option.
parameters.label: Is command
parameters.name: postCommand

parameters.description: If your MQTT topic is limited to a set of one or more specific commands or specific states, define those states here. Separate multiple states with commas. An example for a light bulb state set: ON,DIMMED,OFF
parameters.label: Allowed states
parameters.name: allowedStates

parameterGroups.name: transformations
parameterGroups.label: Transform values
parameterGroups.description: These configuration parameters allow you to alter a value before it is published to MQTT or before a received value is assigned to an item.

parameters.description: An MQTT topic that this thing will subscribe to, to receive the state. This can be left empty, the channel will be state-less command-only channel.
parameters.label: MQTT state topic
parameters.name: stateTopic

parameters.description: An MQTT topic that this thing will send a command to. If not set, this will be a read-only switch.
parameters.label: MQTT command topic
parameters.name: commandTopic

parameters.description: Applies transformations to an incoming MQTT topic value. A transformation example for a received JSON would be "JSONPATH:$.device.status.temperature" for a json {device: {status: { temperature: 23.2 }}}. You can chain transformations by separating them with the intersection character ∩.
parameters.label: Incoming value transformations
parameters.name: transformationPattern

parameters.description: Applies a transformation before publishing a MQTT topic value. Transformations are specialised in extracting a value, but some transformations like the MAP one could be useful.
parameters.label: Outgoing value transformation
parameters.name: transformationPatternOut

parameters.description: Format a value before it is published to the MQTT broker. The default is to just pass the channel/item state. If you want to apply a prefix, say "MYCOLOR,", you would use "MYCOLOR,%s". If you want to adjust the precision of a number to for example 4 digits, you would use "%.4f".
parameters.label: Outgoing value format
parameters.name: formatBeforePublish

parameters.description: The value will be published to the command topic as retained message. A retained value stays on the broker and can even be seen by MQTT clients that are subscribing at a later point in time.
parameters.label: Retained
parameters.name: retained

parameters.description: If the received MQTT value should not only update the state of linked items, but command them, enable this option.
parameters.label: Is command
parameters.name: postCommand

parameters.description: A number (like 1, 10) or a string (like "enabled") that is additionally recognised as on/open state. You can use this parameter for a second keyword, next to ON (OPEN respectively on a Contact).
parameters.label: Custom On/Open value
parameters.name: on

parameters.description: A number (like 0, -10) or a string (like "disabled") that is additionally recognised as off/closed state. You can use this parameter for a second keyword, next to OFF (CLOSED respectively on a Contact).
parameters.label: Custom Off/Closed value
parameters.name: off

parameterGroups.name: transformations
parameterGroups.label: Transform values
parameterGroups.description: These configuration parameters allow you to alter a value before it is published to MQTT or before a received value is assigned to an item.

channel-types.description: Gibt Zeit/Datum an wann das Gerät zuletzt gesehen wurde.
channel-types.label: Zuletzt gesehen

channel-types.description: Gibt an wie lange ein Ping in Millisekunden an das Gerät dauert.
channel-types.label: Pingzeit

channel-types.description: Gibt an ob das Gerät aktuell online oder offline ist.
channel-types.label: Online

channel-types.description: Steuert die Helligkeit und schaltet das Licht ein und aus.
channel-types.label: Helligkeit

channel-types.description: Zeigt den Künstler der (aktuell abgespielten) Video- oder Audiodatei an.
channel-types.label: Künstler

channel-types.description: Zeigt den Titel der (aktuell abgespielten) Video- oder Audiodatei an.
channel-types.label: Titel

channel-types.description: Ermöglicht die Lautstärke auf stumm zu schalten.
channel-types.label: Stumm schalten

channel-types.description: Ermöglicht die Steuerung der Betriebsbereitschaft. Das Gerät ist betriebsbereit, wenn "Betrieb" den Status ON hat.
channel-types.label: Betrieb

extension-repositories.label: Eclipse Marketplace Bindings
extension-repositories.description: Enable this repository to install Bindings from the Eclipse Marketplace.

extension-repositories.label: Eclipse Marketplace Rule Templates
extension-repositories.description: Enable this repository to install Rule Templates from the Eclipse Marketplace.

extension-repositories.label: Eclipse Marketplace Voice
extension-repositories.description: Enable this repository to install Voice services from the Eclipse Marketplace.

extension-repositories.label: OH1 addons
extension-repositories.description: Some Add-ons do not have an OH2 version available. Enable the this repository to install those.

extension-repositories.label: Legacy OH1 addons
extension-repositories.description: Add-ons in this repository have a newer version already. For compatibility and old installations you might want to enable this however.

user-interfaces.label: HABPanel
user-interfaces.description: HABPanel shines on larger screens like tablets. It is a widget based user interface.

user-interfaces.label: REST Api
user-interfaces.description: Interact with the openHAB REST API

item-types.label: Contact
item-types.description: Read-only status of contacts, e.g. door/window contacts.

item-types.label: Dimmer
item-types.description: Percentage value, typically used for dimmers

item-types.label: Group
item-types.description: Item to nest other items / collect them in groups

item-types.label: Player
item-types.description: Allows control of players (e.g. audio players)

item-types.label: Rollershutter
item-types.description: Roller shutter Item, typically used for blinds

item-types.label: Switch
item-types.description: Used for anything that needs to be switched ON and OFF

item-group-function-types.label: All state S1 ⊶ S1
item-group-function-types.description: If all members have state S1, this group has state S1 else state S2

item-group-function-types.label: Average
item-group-function-types.description: Computes the average of all group members

item-group-function-types.label: Count
item-group-function-types.description: Sets the state to the number of members matching the given regular expression with their states.

params.label: Regex
params.description: A regular expression. '.*' for example would match all states.

item-group-function-types.label: Earliest
item-group-function-types.description: Computes the earliest of all group members

item-group-function-types.label: Equal
item-group-function-types.description: Sets the group state to all members equal state otherwise to UNDEF

item-group-function-types.label: Latest
item-group-function-types.description: Computes the latest of all group members

item-group-function-types.label: Maximum
item-group-function-types.description: Computes the maximum of all group members

item-group-function-types.label: Minimum
item-group-function-types.description: Computes the minimum of all group members

item-group-function-types.label: All state S1 ⊶ S2
item-group-function-types.description: If all members have state S1, this group has state S2 else state S1

item-group-function-types.label: Any state S1 ⊶ S2
item-group-function-types.description: If any member is state S1, this group has state S2 else state S1

item-group-function-types.label: Any state S1 ⊶ S1
item-group-function-types.description: If any member is state S1, this group has state S1 else state S2

item-group-function-types.label: Sum
item-group-function-types.description: Computes the sum of all group members

persistence.annotation: Allows an overview of when my items updated to a new value
persistence.label: InfluxDB History

persistence.annotation: Restores all my items on startup
persistence.label: MapDB Restore

persistence.annotation: Stores all items to mapDB for a later restart
persistence.label: MapDB Restore

persistence-services.description: This service allows you to persist state updates using the Amazon DynamoDB database.
persistence-services.label: Amazon DynamoDB Persistence

persistence-services.description: This service allows you to persist and query states using the InfluxDB time series database.
persistence-services.label: InfluxDB

persistence-services.description: This service allows you to persist state updates using a SQL or NoSQL database through the Java Persistence API
persistence-services.label: Java Persistence API

persistence-services.description: The mapdb Persistence Service is based on simple key-value store that only saves the last value. The intention is to use this for restoreOnStartup items because all other persistence options have their drawbacks if values are only needed for reload.
persistence-services.label: mapdb

persistence-services.description: rrd4j is a round-robin database and does not grow in size - it has a fixed allocated size, which is used. This is accomplished by doing data compression, which means that the older the data is, the less values are available. So while you might have a value every minute for the last 24 hours, you might only have one every day for the last year.
persistence-services.label: rrd4j

thing-types.label: Schaltbare Steckdose
thing-types.description: Steckdose zum Ein- und Ausschalten von herkömmlichen Lampen oder anderen elektronischen Geräten.

thing-types.label: Dimmbare Steckdose
thing-types.description: Steckdose zum Dimmen von herkömmlichen Lampen.

thing-types.label: Farbige Lampe

thing-types.label: MQTT Broker
thing-types.description: A connection to a MQTT broker

thing-types.label: HomeAssistant MQTT Component
thing-types.description: You need a configured Broker first. This Thing represents a device, that follows the "HomeAssistant MQTT Component" specification.

thing-types.label: Homie MQTT device
thing-types.description: You need a configured Broker first. This thing represents a device, that follows the "MQTT Homie Convention" (Version 3.x).

thing-types.label: System MQTT Broker
thing-types.description: A system configured and therefore read-only broker connection. Properties are reflecting the configuration and internal connection status.

thing-types.label: Generic MQTT Thing
thing-types.description: You need a configured Broker first. Dynamically add channels of various types to this Thing. Link different MQTT topics to each channel.

thing-types.label: Pingable Netzwerkgerät
thing-types.description: Die Verfügbarkeit des Geräts wird mit ICMP Ping, ARP Ping und DHCP Paketen festgestellt.

thing-types.label: Netzwerkgerät mit Dienst
thing-types.description: Die Verfügbarkeit des Geräts wird durch einen Verbindungsversuch mit dem angegeben TCP Dienst festgestellt.

configParameters.label: IP-Adresse

configParameters.description: Benutzer zur Authentifizierung an der Hue Bridge.
configParameters.label: Benutzer

configParameters.label: Abfrageintervall
configParameters.name: pollingInterval

configParameters.label: Sensor-Abfrageintervall

configParameters.description: The IP/Hostname of the MQTT broker
configParameters.label: Broker Hostname/IP
configParameters.name: host

configParameters.description: The port is optional, if none is provided, the typical ports 1883 and 8883 (SSL) are used.
configParameters.label: Broker Port
configParameters.name: port

configParameters.description: Uses TLS/SSL to establish a secure connection to the broker.
configParameters.label: Secure connection
configParameters.name: secure

configParameters.description: Use a fixed client ID. Defaults to empty which means a client ID is generated for this connection.
configParameters.label: Client ID
configParameters.name: clientID

configParameters.description: Retained messages are stored on the MQTT broker and other clients can retrieve the value at any time
configParameters.label: Retain messages
configParameters.name: retain

configParameters.description: Reconnect time in ms. If a connection is lost, the binding will wait this time before it tries to reconnect.
configParameters.label: Reconnect time
configParameters.name: reconnect_time

configParameters.description: Keep alive / heartbeat timer in ms. It can take up to this time to determine if a server connection is lost. A lower value may keep the broker unnecessarily busy for no or little additional value.
configParameters.label: Heartbeat
configParameters.name: keep_alive_time

configParameters.description: The last will message.
configParameters.label: Last will message
configParameters.name: lastwill_message

configParameters.description: Defaults to empty and therefore disables the last will.
configParameters.label: Last will topic
configParameters.name: lastwill_topic

configParameters.description: The quality of service parameter of the last will.
configParameters.label: Last will QoS
configParameters.name: lastwill_qos

configParameters.description: The MQTT username
configParameters.label: Username
configParameters.name: username

configParameters.description: The MQTT password
configParameters.label: Password
configParameters.name: password

configParameters.description: If this and SSL is set: After the next connection has been successfully established, the certificate is pinned. The connection will be refused if another certificate is used. Clear **certificate** to allow a new certificate for the next connection attempt. This option can increase security.
configParameters.label: Certificate pinning
configParameters.name: certificatepin

configParameters.description: If **certificatepin** is set this hash is used to verify the connection. Clear to allow a new certificate pinning on the next connection attempt. If empty will be filled automatically by the next successful connection. An example input would be `SHA-256:83F9171E06A313118889F7D79302BD1B7A2042EE0CFD029ABF8DD06FFA6CD9D3`.
configParameters.label: Certificate hash
configParameters.name: certificate

configParameters.description: If this and SSL is set: After the next connection has been successfully established, the public key of the broker is pinned. The connection will be refused if another public key is used. Clear **publickey** to allow a new public key for the next connection attempt. This option can increase security.
configParameters.label: Public key pinning
configParameters.name: publickeypin

configParameters.description: If **publickeypin** is set this hash is used to verify the connection. Clear to allow a new public key pinning on the next connection attempt. If empty will be filled automatically by the next successful connection. An example input would be `SHA-256:83F9171E06A313118889F7D79302BD1B7A2042EE0CFD029ABF8DD06FFA6CD9D3`
configParameters.label: Public Key Hash
configParameters.name: publickey

configParameters.description: Gibt an, wie oft der PING wiederholt werden soll, bevor das Gerät als offline markiert wird.

thing-types-extended.label: Pingable Netzwerkgerät
thing-types-extended.description: Die Verfügbarkeit des Geräts wird mit ICMP Ping, ARP Ping und DHCP Paketen festgestellt.

channels.description: Gibt an ob das Gerät aktuell online oder offline ist.
channels.label: Online

channels.description: Gibt an wie lange ein Ping in Millisekunden an das Gerät dauert.
channels.label: Pingzeit

channels.description: Gibt Zeit/Datum an wann das Gerät zuletzt gesehen wurde.
channels.label: Zuletzt gesehen

configParameters.description: Hostname oder IP des Netzwerkgerätes
configParameters.label: Hostname oder IP
configParameters.name: hostname

configParameters.description: Der TCP Port an dem das Gerät erreichbar ist. Muss größer 0 sein.
configParameters.label: Port
configParameters.name: port

configParameters.description: Gibt an, wie oft der Verbindungsversuch wiederholt werden soll, bevor das Gerät als offline markiert wird.
configParameters.label: Wiederholen
configParameters.name: retry

configParameters.description: Gibt an, wie lange maximal gewartet wird (in ms), bevor ein Gerät als nicht vorhanden gekennzeichnet wird.
configParameters.label: Zeitlimit
configParameters.name: timeout

configParameters.description: Spezifiziert das Aktualisierungsintervall (in ms)
configParameters.label: Aktualisierungsintervall
configParameters.name: refreshInterval

thing-types-extended.label: Netzwerkgerät mit Dienst
thing-types-extended.description: Die Verfügbarkeit des Geräts wird durch einen Verbindungsversuch mit dem angegeben TCP Dienst festgestellt.
